TopicTitle: Has anyone suggested a flag designer?

Articles.Content:
An in-game flag designer would be fun

It's probably been asked already.

But I'm asking here. so there!
This is fairly easily done with any image editor and knowledge of where to put the files.
Yeah, sorry but I have to agree with RIC. Lets not fill the game with functionality that can be better served outside the game.
Nice fun idea, though rather than adding it as a stock feature how about a 'how to...' In the KSPedia or create a flag maker as a separate entity, like the Kerbalizer.
How about a solution in between and have a button on the flag screen that takes the file and puts it in the right place?

[quote name='mattinoz']How about a solution in between and have a button on the flag screen that takes the file and puts it in the right place?[/QUOTE]
Rather have extension support, not only for flags (Which are simple place in right folder instalation) but for mods, texture files, and any other current extensions/add-ons to the current game. Right now the system is very simple and straight forward, place stuff into a labelled folder, have module manager updated and start game.
The only knowledge needed is knowing where to put stuff. If this is too much, Squad CAN make their own GUI system to help those unable to figure it out to "Load" their mod/add-on, weather it may be flags, textures, mods ETC. But at the same time this is easy enough any third party program would do, plus I don't think you can be in the actual game to load assets into the game itself, without changing code around.

Idk the current system is so easy all you need is a readme.txt installation file and anyone can figure it out. Arguable adding things into this game is easier than another famous early access sandbox title. (minecraft)
You don't need module manager to make a flag, it's built in. The game loads any 256x160 pixel texture in any folder named "Flags" anywhere in GameData and uses them for flags.
